text: {{Infobox officeholder |honorific-prefix = The Right Honourable |birthname = Christopher Murray Paul-Huhne |image = Chris Huhne (cropped).jpg |honorific- suffix = MP |office = Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change |primeminister = David Cameron |term_start = 12 May 2010 |term_end = 3 February 2012 |predecessor = Ed Miliband |successor = Ed Davey |office2 = Liberal Democrat Spokesman for Home Affairs |leader2 = Nick Clegg |term_start2 = 20 December 2007 |term_end2 = 12 May 2010 |predecessor2 = Nick Clegg |successor2 = Vacant |office3 = Liberal Democrat Spokesman for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs |leader3 = Menzies Campbell Vince Cable (Acting) |term_start3 = 3 March 2006 |term_end3 = 19 December 2007 |predecessor3 = Norman Baker |successor3 = Steve Webb |office4 = Liberal Democrat Spokesman for Chief Secretary to the Treasury |leader4 = Charles Kennedy Menzies Campbell |term_start4 = 16 May 2005 |term_end4 = 3 March 2006 |predecessor4 = David Laws |successor4 = Colin Breed |office5 = Member of Parliament for Eastleigh |term_start5 = 5 May 2005 |term_end5 = |predecessor5 = David Chidgey |successor5 = |majority5 = 3,864 (7.2%) |office6 = Member of the European Parliament for South East England |parliament6 = |term_start6 = 10 June 1999 |term_end6 = 12 May 2005 |predecessor6 = Constituency created |successor6 = Sharon Bowles |birth_date = |birth_place = Westminster, London, United Kingdom |death_date = |death_place = |party = Liberal Democrats |spouse = Vicky Pryce (m. 1984–2011, divorced) |children = 3 |alma_mater = University of Paris Magdalen College, Oxford |website = Official website }} Christopher Murray- Paul Huhne, commonly known as Chris Huhne (born 2 July 1954) is a British politician. He was born in London and was a member of the Liberal Democrats until 2013. In the 1980s he tried in vain to become an MP on behalf of the Social Democratic Party. He was the Member of Parliament for Eastleigh from May 2005 until February 2013. He was the United Kingdom's Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change from May 2010 until February 2012.Chris Huhne quits cabinet over speeding claims charge, BBC News, 3 February 2012. When he was in that job, he decided on the most efficient ways of having electricity and other important resources in Britain. There was an article in the newspaper that said Huhne wanted to have more nuclear power stations. A lot of people think this is wrong. Huhne was married to Greek economist Vicky Pryce (born 1952) from 1984 until they separated in 2010 and divorced in 2011.
